qas.question: What August 1965 event caused Eisenhower to drop out of public life?
For what ailment did Eisenhower receive surgery in 1966?
What did Eisenhower have removed via surgery on December 12, 1966?
In what year did Eisenhower die?
How many heart attacks did Eisenhower have between 1955 and 1969?

context: The last three years of Eisenhower's second term in office were ones of relatively good health. Eventually after leaving the White House, he suffered several additional and ultimately crippling heart attacks. A severe <a0_0>heart attack<a0_0/> in August 1965 largely ended his participation in public affairs. In August 1966 he began to show symptoms of <a1_0>cholecystitis<a1_0/>, for which he underwent surgery on December 12, 1966, when his <a2_0>gallbladder<a2_0/> was removed, containing 16 gallstones. After Eisenhower's death in <a3_0>1969<a3_0/> (see below), an autopsy unexpectedly revealed an adrenal pheochromocytoma, a benign adrenaline-secreting tumor that may have made the President more vulnerable to heart disease. Eisenhower suffered <a4_0>seven<a4_0/> heart attacks in total from 1955 until his death.
